citation.article-title: Pseudonocardia acaciae sp. nov., isolated from roots of Acacia auriculiformis A. Cunn. ex Benth.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudonocardia acaciae sp. nov.

Pseudonocardia acaciae (a.ca.ci′ae. L. n. acacia the acacia tree and also the name of a botanical genus; L. gen. n. acaciae of Acacia, referring to the isolation of the type strain from roots of Acacia auriculiformis A. Cunn. ex Benth.).
Aerobic, Gram-positive-staining, non-acid–alcohol-fast.
Forms yellowish-white aerial mycelium and yellowish-brown substrate mycelium on ISP 2 agar.
The spiny spores occur in chains.
Growth occurs in both standing and shake-flask cultures.
Catalase, nitrate reduction and urease are positive.
H2S is not produced.
Acid is produced from adonitol, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-glucose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, ribose and d-xylose.
No acid production from d-galactose, lactose, maltose, melezitose, raffinose, d-sorbitol or sucrose.
Weak acid production from glycerol, myo-inositol and mannitol.
Hydrolyses gelatin and starch, but not casein.
Growth occurs at pH 5.0–8.0, with an optimum at pH 6.0–7.0.
The temperature range for growth is 18–42 °C, with an optimum at 36–38 °C.
On ISP 2 agar, good growth occurs at 0–1 % NaCl, moderate growth at 2 % NaCl and poor growth at 3–5 % NaCl.

Esterase (C4), lipase (C8), leucine aminopeptidase and valine aminopeptidase are detected with the API ZYM enzyme assay; acid and alkaline phosphatases, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, trypsin, phosphoamidase, chymotrypsin, cystine aminopeptidase, α-fucosidase, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are not detected.
The diagnostic diamino acid of the peptidoglycan is meso-A2pm.
Whole-cell sugars are arabinose and galactose.
The glycan moiety of the murein is acetylated.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-8(H4).
Mycolic acids are not detected.
The fatty acid profile is dominated by iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, 10-methyl C16 : 0, C17 : 1ω6c, iso-C17 : 0, 10-methyl C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
Other cellular fatty acids detected as minor components (<5 %) are C17 : 1ω8c, C17 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 1 H, iso-C18 : 0, C16 : 1 2-OH, C18 : 1ω9c, iso-C14 : 0 and C12 : 0 2-OH.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 71.6 mol%.
The type strain, strain GMKU095T (=NRRL B-24609T =BCC 28481T =TISTR 1862T =NBRC 104274T), was isolated from roots of Acacia auriculiformis A.
Cunn. ex Benth., collected from Kasetsart University, Bangkok, Thailand.
